user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_register_generic_device:
```c
int metal_register_generic_device(struct metal_device *device)
{
	if (!device->name || !strlen(device->name) ||
	    device->num_regions > METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS)
		return -EINVAL;

	device->bus = &metal_generic_bus;
	metal_list_add_tail(&_metal.common.generic_device_list,
			    &device->node);
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_register_generic_device:
struct metal_device {
	const char             *name;       /**< Device name */
	struct metal_bus       *bus;        /**< Bus that contains device */
	unsigned int           num_regions; /**< Number of I/O regions in
						 device */
	struct metal_io_region regions[METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS]; /**< Array of
							I/O regions in device*/
	struct metal_list      node;       /**< Node on bus' list of devices */
	int                    irq_num;    /**< Number of IRQs per device */
	void                   *irq_info;  /**< IRQ ID */
}
...
struct metal_bus metal_weak metal_generic_bus = {
	.name = "generic",
	.ops  = {
		.bus_close = NULL,
		.dev_open  = metal_generic_dev_open,
		.dev_close = NULL,
		.dev_irq_ack = NULL,
		.dev_dma_map = metal_generic_dev_dma_map,
		.dev_dma_unmap = metal_generic_dev_dma_unmap,
	},
}
...
extern struct metal_state _metal
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
struct metal_bus metal_weak metal_generic_bus = {
	.name = "generic",
	.ops  = {
		.bus_close = NULL,
		.dev_open  = metal_generic_dev_open,
		.dev_close = NULL,
		.dev_irq_ack = NULL,
		.dev_dma_map = metal_generic_dev_dma_map,
		.dev_dma_unmap = metal_generic_dev_dma_unmap,
	},
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: If struct metal_bus::name is declared as a non-const pointer (e.g. char *name), then initializing .name = "generic" makes the pointer refer to a string literal without const qualification. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13, the pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible (i.e. const char *name). Thus this initialization violates Rule 8.13. If, however, metal_bus::name is already declared as const char *name, there is no violation.
